definitions.definition: to ask someone if they would like to have something or if they would like you to do something:
examples: [ + two objects ] I feel bad that I didn't offer them any food/offer any food to them.

definitions.definition: to say a prayer or make a sacrifice (= an act of killing or giving up something) to a god:
examples: Dear Lord, we offer up our prayers...

definitions.definition: the act of asking if someone would like to have something or if they would like you to do something:
examples: "If you like I can help out." "That's a very kind offer."

definitions.definition: to say officially that you would like to buy something, especially a house, at a particular price:
examples: They were asking €180,000 for the apartment, so I put in an offer of €170,000.

definitions.definition: a reduction in the usual price of sth, usually for a short period:
examples: Don't miss out on our latest offer.

definitions.definition: available to be bought or used:
examples: We were amazed at the range of products on offer.

definitions.definition: If goods in a shop are on (special) offer, they are being sold at a lower price than usual.
If a house is under offer, someone has already suggested a particular price at which they would be willing to buy it.
